intro: Pilosella glaucescens subsp. megalocymophora, commonly known as the large-cyme pilosella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow flowers arranged in dense, flat clusters. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
